text: Pours clear amber. Aroma slightly hoppy, slightly malty. Toffee and bread. Taste is slightly roasted, toffee, bread.

Bottle from brewery, batch #11. Aroma of caramel, toffee, some floral notes. Dark golden/amber, hazy, small off-white head. Medium- sweetness, medium bitterness, tastes of malts, some citrusy fruitiness, bitterness up front. Medium body, medium carbonation, good mouthfeel. Good and tasty dark lager, well brewed.

Bottle at tasting. Poured a clear dark brown/full red with no head. Nose has caramel, flarn and fudge. Tastes of bitter caramel, butterscotch (the good kind) accompanied by some slight bubbles. I have a good feeling about this one

Fra fat på Cardinal april-15: klr rødlig kobber med fint skum som varer. Et godt, maltdrevet øl med deilig humleprofil - karamell, hagebærbusker (solbær/rips) og antydning til grønne epler. God munnfylde og lett å drikke. Kveldens første øl, en bra start på denne Mandag i annen!
Tap at Cardinal. Pours almost clear dark golden with a small creamy white head. Aroma of caramel with a fruity note. Taste is moderate sweet caramel, with a dry good bitter herbal finish. Pleasant.

From tap at Mi2 at Cardinal 20.04.15. Slightly hazy, pale orange. Diminishing beige head. Moderate aroma of crystal malt, with a slight hint of green apples. Fine taste, with good balance between malt and moderate hops. Filling mouthfeel.

On tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Hazy reddish amber colour, large head, slightly off-white. Aroma of redcurrant and blackcurrant bushes, also notes of wood, a hint of smoke. Well hopped and refreshing flavour, medium dry. Slightly fruity, but also woody notes. Medium bitter finish.
On tap at Kick. Pale amber colour with abeige head. Aroma is roasted malt, fruit, hop, caramel. Flavour is roasted malt, fruit, hop, caramel, bread. Bitter finish. Ordinary/OK beer.

Draught @ Gastropuben KICK Malt & Mat, Kristiansand
Pours clear copper/amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long malty and floral finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap @ Kick. Unclear golden body with a medium sized, lacing of-white head. Aroma has a lot of fruit and freshly baked bread. Flavor is quite fruity as well with bread, yeast and some caramel malt with pleasant bitterness. Medium body and quite much bread in aftertaste as well. Interesting as a lager, does not remind me of any other lager at all. Have a slight suspicion that the previous beer at the tap line could have some influence on the flavor. Anyway not bad at all.

On tap at Kick. A hazy amber colored beer with a dense finger thick off-white head. Its rather malty on the nose, bread, caramel and a faint roasted touch. Herbal, light resiny hops. Its full bodied and softly carbonated, with bready malts, some caramel and a nice bitterness in the flavor. Lasting finish. Quite pleasant and easy drinkable, was a bit surprised over the maltyness, but its nice anyway. 140717

On tap at cafe Sara, june 20th 2014. Clear dark amber body with a tiny beige head. Lightly roasted malt aroma with caramel and ash. Taste of earthy hops, caramel, lightly roasted. Good dry bitterness, with a light sweet aftertaste.

200ml draught, from the Ølbrett menu at Café Sara. Clear copper coloured body. Filmy layer at the surface. Malt-fruity aroma of caramel and resin-like hops. Mixed taste of roasted dark malts, earth and fruity hops. Moderate bittersweet endnotes. Medium bodied. Drinks well (Oslo 20.06.2014).

Appearance: Clear nutty color with a fine off white head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Malty, nutty, roasted and hints of crystal malt.Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a balanced bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Wood, roasted malt, mild peat caramel malt.Overall impression: Lovely tasty ale.Personal stats: On tap @ Cafe Sara in Oslo, Norway - shared with Mr tfredvik

On tap at Cafe Sara. 
Glowing brass. Lovely beer, Id classify this as an Alt. Fruity, yet dry. More carbonated than a standard Alt, thoug, not for the worse at all. Wood, resin, blackcurrants. Dry tail.

Medium amber body with a small, white head. Strong aroma of caramel, fruitiness and roasted notes with hints of wood smoke. The smoke is present in the flavour as well, making this stand out from the crowd of vienna lagers available in Norwegian grocery stores. The taste is light sweet with a long and moderate to light bitter finish. Mid-bodied, dry texture and moderate carbonation. A fun one.
[sample @ Café Sara, Oslo]
